  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* The PDA automaton for parsers generated by camlyacc */

  20. #include <stdio.h>
  21. #include <string.h>
  22. #include "caml/config.h"
  23. #include "caml/mlvalues.h"
  24. #include "caml/memory.h"
  25. #include "caml/alloc.h"
  26. #include "caml/startup.h"

  28. ‌#define ERRCODE 256

  30. ‌struct parser_tables {    /* Mirrors parse_tables in ../stdlib/parsing.mli */
  31.   value actions;
  32.   value transl_const;
  33.   value transl_block;
  34.   char * lhs;
  35.   char * len;
  36.   char * defred;
  37.   char * dgoto;
  38.   char * sindex;
  39.   char * rindex;
  40.   char * gindex;
  41.   value tablesize;
  42.   char * table;
  43.   char * check;
  44.   value error_function;
  45.   char * names_const;
  46.   char * names_block;
  47. };

  49. ‌struct parser_env {       /* Mirrors parser_env in ../stdlib/parsing.ml */
  50.   value s_stack;
  51.   value v_stack;
  52.   value symb_start_stack;
  53.   value symb_end_stack;
  54.   value stacksize;
  55.   value stackbase;
  56.   value curr_char;
  57.   value lval;
  58.   value symb_start;
  59.   value symb_end;
  60.   value asp;
  61.   value rule_len;
  62.   value rule_number;
  63.   value sp;
  64.   value state;
  65.   value errflag;
  66. };

  68. #if defined(ARCH_BIG_ENDIAN) || SIZEOF_SHORT != 2
  69. ‌#define Short(tbl,n) \
  70.   (*((unsigned char *)((tbl) + (n) * 2)) + \
  71.           (*((signed char *)((tbl) + (n) * 2 + 1)) << 8))
  72. #else
  73. ‌#define Short(tbl,n) (((short *)(tbl))[n])
  74. #endif

  76. /* Input codes */
  77. /* Mirrors parser_input in ../stdlib/parsing.ml */
  78. ‌#define START 0
  79. ‌#define TOKEN_READ 1
  80. ‌#define STACKS_GROWN_1 2
  81. ‌#define STACKS_GROWN_2 3
  82. ‌#define SEMANTIC_ACTION_COMPUTED 4
  83. ‌#define ERROR_DETECTED 5

  85. /* Output codes */
  86. /* Mirrors parser_output in ../stdlib/parsing.ml */
  87. ‌#define READ_TOKEN Val_int(0)
  88. ‌#define RAISE_PARSE_ERROR Val_int(1)
  89. ‌#define GROW_STACKS_1 Val_int(2)
  90. ‌#define GROW_STACKS_2 Val_int(3)
  91. ‌#define COMPUTE_SEMANTIC_ACTION Val_int(4)
  92. ‌#define CALL_ERROR_FUNCTION Val_int(5)

  94. /* To preserve local variables when communicating with the ML code */

  96. ‌#define SAVE \
  97.   env->sp = Val_int(sp), \
  98.   env->state = Val_int(state), \
  99.   env->errflag = Val_int(errflag)

  101. ‌#define RESTORE \
  102.   sp = Int_val(env->sp), \
  103.   state = Int_val(env->state), \
  104.   errflag = Int_val(env->errflag)

  106. /* Auxiliary for printing token just read */

  108. ‌static char * token_name(char * names, int number)
  109. {
  110.   for (/*nothing*/; number > 0; number--) {
  111.     if (names[0] == 0) return "<unknown token>";
  112.     names += strlen(names) + 1;
  113.   }
  114.   return names;
  115. }

  117. ‌static void print_token(struct parser_tables *tables, int state, value tok)
  118. {
  119.   value v;

  121.   if (Is_long(tok)) {
  122.     fprintf(stderr, "State %d: read token %s\n",
  123.             state, token_name(tables->names_const, Int_val(tok)));
  124.   } else {
  125.     fprintf(stderr, "State %d: read token %s(",
  126.             state, token_name(tables->names_block, Tag_val(tok)));
  127.     v = Field(tok, 0);
  128.     if (Is_long(v))
  129.       fprintf(stderr, "%" ARCH_INTNAT_PRINTF_FORMAT "d", Long_val(v));
  130.     else if (Tag_val(v) == String_tag)
  131.       fprintf(stderr, "%s", String_val(v));
  132.     else if (Tag_val(v) == Double_tag)
  133.       fprintf(stderr, "%g", Double_val(v));
  134.     else
  135.       fprintf(stderr, "_");
  136.     fprintf(stderr, ")\n");
  137.   }
  138.   fflush(stderr);
  139. }

  141. ‌static int trace(void)
  142. {
  143.   return caml_params->parser_trace || Caml_state->parser_trace;
  144. }

  146. ‌static void print_trace (const char *template, ...){
  147.   va_list ap;
  148.   if(trace()) {
  149.      va_start (ap, template);
  150.      vfprintf (stderr, template, ap);
  151.      va_end (ap);
  152.      /* Windows seem to sometimes perform buffering on stderr. Better
  153.         to flush explicitly. */
  154.      fflush(stderr);
  155.   }
  156. }

  158. /* The pushdown automata */

  160. ‌CAMLprim value caml_parse_engine(struct parser_tables *tables,
  161.                                  struct parser_env *env, value cmd, value arg)
  162. {
  163.   int state;
  164.   mlsize_t sp, asp;
  165.   int errflag;
  166.   int n, n1, n2, m, state1;

  168.   switch(Int_val(cmd)) {

  170.   case START:
  171.     state = 0;
  172.     sp = Int_val(env->sp);
  173.     errflag = 0;

  175.   loop:
  176.     n = Short(tables->defred, state);
  177.     if (n != 0) goto reduce;
  178.     if (Int_val(env->curr_char) >= 0) goto testshift;
  179.     SAVE;
  180.     return READ_TOKEN;
  181.                                 /* The ML code calls the lexer and updates */
  182.                                 /* symb_start and symb_end */
  183.   case TOKEN_READ:
  184.     RESTORE;
  185.     if (Is_block(arg)) {
  186.       env->curr_char = Field(tables->transl_block, Tag_val(arg));
  187.       caml_modify(&env->lval, Field(arg, 0));
  188.     } else {
  189.       env->curr_char = Field(tables->transl_const, Int_val(arg));
  190.       caml_modify(&env->lval, Val_long(0));
  191.     }
  192.     if (trace()) print_token(tables, state, arg);

  194.   testshift:
  195.     n1 = Short(tables->sindex, state);
  196.     n2 = n1 + Int_val(env->curr_char);
  197.     if (n1 != 0 && n2 >= 0 && n2 <= Int_val(tables->tablesize) &&
  198.         Short(tables->check, n2) == Int_val(env->curr_char)) goto shift;
  199.     n1 = Short(tables->rindex, state);
  200.     n2 = n1 + Int_val(env->curr_char);
  201.     if (n1 != 0 && n2 >= 0 && n2 <= Int_val(tables->tablesize) &&
  202.         Short(tables->check, n2) == Int_val(env->curr_char)) {
  203.       n = Short(tables->table, n2);
  204.       goto reduce;
  205.     }
  206.     if (errflag > 0) goto recover;
  207.     SAVE;
  208.     return CALL_ERROR_FUNCTION;
  209.                                 /* The ML code calls the error function */
  210.   case ERROR_DETECTED:
  211.     RESTORE;
  212.   recover:
  213.     if (errflag < 3) {
  214.       errflag = 3;
  215.       while (1) {
  216.         state1 = Int_val(Field(env->s_stack, sp));
  217.         n1 = Short(tables->sindex, state1);
  218.         n2 = n1 + ERRCODE;
  219.         if (n1 != 0 && n2 >= 0 && n2 <= Int_val(tables->tablesize) &&
  220.             Short(tables->check, n2) == ERRCODE) {
  221.           print_trace("Recovering in state %d\n", state1);
  222.           goto shift_recover;
  223.         } else {
  224.           print_trace("Discarding state %d\n", state1);
  225.           if (sp <= Int_val(env->stackbase)) {
  226.             print_trace("No more states to discard\n");
  227.             return RAISE_PARSE_ERROR; /* The ML code raises Parse_error */
  228.           }
  229.           sp--;
  230.         }
  231.       }
  232.     } else {
  233.       if (Int_val(env->curr_char) == 0)
  234.         return RAISE_PARSE_ERROR; /* The ML code raises Parse_error */
  235.       print_trace("Discarding last token read\n");
  236.       env->curr_char = Val_int(-1);
  237.       goto loop;
  238.     }

  240.   shift:
  241.     env->curr_char = Val_int(-1);
  242.     if (errflag > 0) errflag--;
  243.   shift_recover:
  244.     print_trace("State %d: shift to state %d\n",
  245.                 state, Short(tables->table, n2));
  246.     state = Short(tables->table, n2);
  247.     sp++;
  248.     if (sp < Long_val(env->stacksize)) goto push;
  249.     SAVE;
  250.     return GROW_STACKS_1;
  251.                                  /* The ML code resizes the stacks */
  252.   case STACKS_GROWN_1:
  253.     RESTORE;
  254.   push:
  255.     Field(env->s_stack, sp) = Val_int(state);
  256.     caml_modify(&Field(env->v_stack, sp), env->lval);
  257.     Store_field (env->symb_start_stack, sp, env->symb_start);
  258.     Store_field (env->symb_end_stack, sp, env->symb_end);
  259.     goto loop;

  261.   reduce:
  262.     print_trace("State %d: reduce by rule %d\n", state, n);
  263.     m = Short(tables->len, n);
  264.     env->asp = Val_int(sp);
  265.     env->rule_number = Val_int(n);
  266.     env->rule_len = Val_int(m);
  267.     sp = sp - m + 1;
  268.     m = Short(tables->lhs, n);
  269.     state1 = Int_val(Field(env->s_stack, sp - 1));
  270.     n1 = Short(tables->gindex, m);
  271.     n2 = n1 + state1;
  272.     if (n1 != 0 && n2 >= 0 && n2 <= Int_val(tables->tablesize) &&
  273.         Short(tables->check, n2) == state1) {
  274.       state = Short(tables->table, n2);
  275.     } else {
  276.       state = Short(tables->dgoto, m);
  277.     }
  278.     if (sp < Long_val(env->stacksize)) goto semantic_action;
  279.     SAVE;
  280.     return GROW_STACKS_2;
  281.                                 /* The ML code resizes the stacks */
  282.   case STACKS_GROWN_2:
  283.     RESTORE;
  284.   semantic_action:
  285.     SAVE;
  286.     return COMPUTE_SEMANTIC_ACTION;
  287.                                 /* The ML code calls the semantic action */
  288.   case SEMANTIC_ACTION_COMPUTED:
  289.     RESTORE;
  290.     Field(env->s_stack, sp) = Val_int(state);
  291.     caml_modify(&Field(env->v_stack, sp), arg);
  292.     asp = Int_val(env->asp);
  293.     Store_field (env->symb_end_stack, sp, Field(env->symb_end_stack, asp));
  294.     if (sp > asp) {
  295.       /* This is an epsilon production. Take symb_start equal to symb_end. */
  296.       Store_field (env->symb_start_stack, sp, Field(env->symb_end_stack, asp));
  297.     }
  298.     goto loop;

  300.   default:                      /* Should not happen */
  301.     CAMLassert(0);
  302.     return RAISE_PARSE_ERROR;   /* Keeps gcc -Wall happy */
  303.   }

  305. }

  307. /* Control printing of debugging info */

  309. ‌CAMLprim value caml_set_parser_trace(value flag)
  310. {
  311.   value oldflag = Val_bool(trace());
  312.   Caml_state->parser_trace = Bool_val(flag);
  313.   return oldflag;
  314. }
